meanings.definition: To transfer a plant to a new pot.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy repotting my houseplants to give them more space to grow.
meanings.sent2: Gardening enthusiasts often repot their plants to ensure healthy growth.
meanings.sent3: After repotting the flowers, they seemed to dance happily in their new homes.
meanings.sent4: Repotting is like giving a plant a fresh start in a bigger home.
meanings.sent5: The process of repotting can rejuvenate a plant and make it thrive.

meanings.definition: The act of moving a plant to a different container.
meanings.sent1: Repotting is necessary when a plant outgrows its current pot.
meanings.sent2: I bought a beautiful ceramic pot for the repotting of my favorite succulent.
meanings.sent3: The repotting of the cactus turned into a comical struggle with spiky obstacles.
meanings.sent4: In the world of plants, repotting symbolizes growth and change.
meanings.sent5: The repotting of the orchid was a delicate operation, like a surgeon moving a patient to a new room.
